Agreed with machan12. I'm also an avid NTR hater, so I've dedicated time to investigate what exactly NTR is and compare it to Manga I stumble upon. This is not it. For it to be NTR, you need the story to be told from the perspective of the person being cucked. This is the MC cheating on his wife, so it's reverse NTR at most, but more accurately only cheating, because not only is he not "stolen", his wife never even finds out, so no NTR.

I read the story. As a dedicated NTR hater, this is not NTR. There was no "taking," the minimum requirement for an NTR story. Leaving aside the arguments about the actual applicability of NTR to say a sister being fucked by a gyaru-oh asshole, this doujin features a man engaged in several affairs. The JK was not "taken" from her boyfriend nor was the husband "taken" from his wife. Is this cheating/infidelity? 100%. Is it NTR? No.
